        public java.math.BigDecimal calcHeiderBalanceBasedOnAllTriangle​(double[][] k,
                                                                int n,
                                                                int type)
        This function calculates the index of Heider balance state based on all triangles in particles.
        Parameters:
        k - sps_p.ParameterKij represents "to what extent person i prefers person j" defined in the Kano's thesis.
        Returns:
        The average of Heider balance state per a triangle.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • balanceWithAverage

        private java.math.BigDecimal balanceWithAverage​(double[][] k,
                                                int[] c,
                                                int n,
                                                int t)
        Calculate the Heider balance state with an average of sps_p.ParameterKij and Kji. i.e. c[] = {1, 4, 39}; There is the 3 connections in c[] defined MEMO_3C2. {1, 4}, {1, 39}, {4, 39} Calculate the average of each combination. (K(1->4) + K(4->1)) / 2 (K(1->39) + K(39->1)) / 2 (K(4->39) + K(39->3)) / 2 Then, multiply all averages.
        Parameters:
        k - sps_p.ParameterKij represents "to what extent person i prefers person j" defined in the Kano's thesis.
        c - The 3 particle's indexes.
        n - The total number of particles.
        t - The number of type.
        Returns:
        Result of Heider balance state.

      • balanceWithPOX

        private java.math.BigDecimal balanceWithPOX​(double[][] k,
                                            int[] c,
                                            int n,
                                            int t)
        Calculate the Heider balance state with 6 pattens average of POX. In HB theory, only P->O, P->X, O->X directions are valid. i.e. c[] = {1, 4, 39}; All possible patterns are 3! = 3P3 = 6. The number of patterns is always 6 and defined by MEMO_3P3. P | O | X =============== 1 | 4 | 39 1 | 39 | 4 4 | 1 | 39 4 | 39 | 1 39 | 1 | 4 39 | 4 | 1 Calculate the average of the sum of each pattern. ( K(1->4) * K(1->39) * K(4->39) + K(1->39) * K(1->4) * K(4->39) + K(4->1) * K(4->39) * K(1->39) + .... ) / 6
        Parameters:
        k - sps_p.ParameterKij represents "to what extent person i prefers person j" defined in the Kano's thesis.
        c - The 3 particle's indexes.
        n - The total number of particles.
        t - The number of type.
        Returns:
        Result of Heider balance state.
